messages.body: $TSLA  Bitcoin Price to Test $20k Ahead of CME Launch Sunday http://bit.ly/2CJpABQ via @CoinDesk

links.title: Sell the News? Bitcoin Price Tests $20k Ahead of CME's Futures Launch - CoinDesk
links.description: The upside move in bitcoin has gathered traction this weekend as investors brace up for BTC futures launch by the CME. As per CoinDesk's Bitcoin Price Index (BPI), the world's largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization rose to a new all-time high of $19,783.06 at 12:14 UTC today.

$TSLA Senate Republican Cornyn: "I am confident will pass this bill, probably on Tuesday." http://www.forexlive.com/news/!/senate-republican-cornyn-i-am-confident-will-pass-this-bill-probably-on-tuesday-20171217

links.title: Senate Republican Cornyn: "I am confident will pass this bill, probably on Tuesday."
links.description: The No. 2 Senate Republican, John Cornyn (Texax-R) said on ABC's "This Week" that he "is confident" Congress will pass this bill. He expects it to be done on Tuesday. He also said that it was unclear if Arizona Senator John McCain would vote.

links.description: Tesla Inc. designs, develops, manufactures, and sells electric vehicles, electric vehicle powertrain components, and stationary energy storage systems in the United States, China, Norway, and internationally. links.title: Tesla Could See A Major Inflection In Free Cash Flow Next Year (NASDAQ:TSLA)
links.description: Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) short sellers have gained fuel amid Model 3 setbacks and temporary capital solutions leveraging new vehicle reservations. But Morgan Stanley thinks those justifications are soon to dissolve. Analyst Adam Jonas maintained an Equal Weight rating on the stock with a $379 price target.

messages.body: $TSLA bloomberg link https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2017-12-15/chinese-startup-nio-is-said-to-consider-u-s-listing-next-year

links.title: Chinese Startup NIO Considers U.S. Listing Next Year
links.description: Tencent-backed firm also weighs sale of stake in U.S. unit Electric-car seeks funds to develop self-driving technology Chinese electric-car startup NIO is considering an initial public offering in the U.S. as soon as next year as it seeks funds to invest in areas including self-driving technology, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
